categories.name: Explosive History: The Science and Stories of Detonation

questions.clue: This Chinese invention, originally used for fireworks, revolutionized warfare and is known as black powder.
Alfred Nobel invented this explosive material in 1867, which led to the creation of the Nobel Prizes.
This type of explosive, used in World War I, is made by mixing ammonium nitrate with fuel oil.
This explosive compound, often depicted in movies, is known for its instability and sensitivity to shock.
This explosive material, used in nuclear weapons, is a radioactive isotope of uranium.

categories.name: Sushi Savvy: Rolls, Fish, and the Art of Japanese Cuisine

questions.clue: This type of sushi roll, typically wrapped in seaweed, translates to 'hand roll' and is often shaped like a cone.
A popular sushi ingredient, this fish is also known for its bright orange color and high Omega-3 content.
In sushi preparation, this explosive green condiment is made from a plant in the horseradish family.
Nigiri sushi consists of a slice of raw fish over pressed vinegared rice; this term describes the fish part of the sushi.
This traditional Japanese vinegar rice roll gets its name from an ancient method of fermenting fish with rice, known for its explosive, pungent flavor.

categories.name: Mythical Creatures: Legends from Around the World

questions.clue: For 200: This fire-breathing creature, often depicted with wings and scales, is a staple in European folklore.
For 400: Known for their untamed beauty, these one-horned creatures are said to be attracted to pure maidens.
For 600: This Japanese water-dwelling creature is known for its mischievous nature and a liking for cucumbers and sumo wrestling.
For 800: In Chinese mythology, this creature is a wise, long-lived being often associated with the element of water and fish-like features.
For 1000: Originating from Filipino folklore, this monstrous creature has a penchant for eating human flesh and can split its body in half.

categories.name: Architectural Wonders: From Ancient Ruins to Modern Marvels

questions.clue: This ancient Greek temple dedicated to Athena is located on the Acropolis of Athens.
This iconic Japanese castle is known for its white exterior and is sometimes called the 'White Heron Castle.'
This explosive architectural marvel in Dubai holds the title as the tallest building in the world.
This ancient Incan city, located high in the Andes Mountains, is often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas.'
Designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, this Pennsylvania house is famous for its cantilevered structure over a waterfall.
For $200: This artist painted the 'Mona Lisa' and 'The Last Supper'.
For $400: This sculptor created the famous marble statue of 'David', completed in 1504.
For $600: This artist, known for the 'School of Athens', was a master of perspective and composition.
For $800: This movement, known for its use of light and shadow, includes artists like Caravaggio and Artemisia Gentileschi.
For $1000: This Northern Renaissance artist, famous for his detailed landscapes and peasant scenes, painted 'The Hunters in the Snow'.
